intro: Aphanes australiana, commonly known as the Australian sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are typically covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Aphanes australiana is well adapted to arid conditions and requires minimal water once established.
